action.action-desc: Mr. Faso (for himself, Mr. Renacci, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide educational resources regarding opioid use and pain management as part of the Medicare & You handbook.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicare Opioid Safety Education Act of 2018.

section.header: Provision of information regarding opioid use and pain management as part of Medicare & You handbook

subsection.text: Section 1804 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395b–2) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
The notice provided under subsection (a) shall include—

paragraph.text: educational resources, compiled by the Secretary, regarding opioid use and pain management; and
a description of alternative, non-opioid pain management treatments covered under this title.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to notices distributed prior to each Medicare open enrollment period beginning after January 1, 2019.
